FuncDef:
The ptp enable command enables PTP on a specific device.
The undo ptp enable command disables PTP on a specific device.
By default, PTP is disabled on a device.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
PTP is enabled in the system and interface views.
Run the ptp enable command in the system view to enable PTP on a device. PTP functions can be configured in the system view.
Run the ptp enable command to enable PTP on an interface so that the interface can send and receive PTP packets. If an interface is selected as the beset master clock, the device where the interface resides can perform clock synchronization using the PTP packets received by the interface.
Precautions
The main control board and subcard must support PTP. That is, hardware support for PTP is mandatory. The 10GE interfaces in WAN mode do not support PTP.
